text: A grid plan is the first basic plan in urban planning. It is a type of city plan in which streets run at right angles to each other, forming a grid. In ancient Rome a grid plan method of land measurement was called a centuriation. Early grid-plans were developed in Indus Valley civilization. It was also widely used in ancient Greece.Michael Gagarin; Elaine Fantham, The Oxford Encyclopedia of Ancient Greece and Rome, Vol. 5 (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2010), p. 154 == Related pages == * Sector model * Multiple nuclei model * Concentric zone model * Linear city model == References == == Other websites == * Historical Society of Pennsylvania * The Great American Grid Category:Urban planning Category:Urban design
